Package pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a chess piece.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove​(Board board,
                       Player player,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> start_cell)
        This function determines if, given a starting cell, the piece can do a move on the board. It also checks that the player is not in check after the move.
        Parameters:
        board - The board to consider
        player - The player owning the piece
        start_cell - The starting cell to consider
        Returns:
        A boolean for the purpose

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove​(Board board,
                       Player player,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> start_cell,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> end_cell)
        This function determines if, given a starting and ending cell, the piece can do the move on the board. It also checks that the player is not in check after the move.
        Parameters:
        board - The board to consider
        player - The player owning the piece
        start_cell - The starting cell to consider
        end_cell - The ending cell to consider
        Returns:
        A boolean for the purpose

      • allowedMove

        public boolean allowedMove​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> start_cell,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> end_cell)
        Checks that the move is in allowed_moves
        Parameters:
        start_cell - The starting cell to consider
        end_cell - The ending cell to consider
        Returns:
        A boolean for the purpose

      • canGoThrough

        public boolean canGoThrough​(Piece[][] board_game,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> start_cell,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> end_cell)
        Checks whether the piece is stopped by other pieces for moving. The default behaviour is a piece cannot go through another piece.
        Parameters:
        board_game - The board to consider
        start_cell - The starting cell to consider
        end_cell - The ending cell to consider
        Returns:
        A boolean for the purpose

      • getDirection

        protected int getDirection()
        Gets the direction. Indeed depends on the piece, some pieces have a direction - the pawns.
        Returns:
        The direction (1 or -1, by default 1)
